 
Vaishnav was running to the lunch hall with chopsticks to have a chineese lunch with his friends. As clumsy as he is, he hit a wall and dropped the chopsticks. He quickly grabbed some and reached the lunch hall to meet his friends in time. But alas! Only then did he realise that only chopsticks of the same length can be used to eat lunch. Help Vaishnav figure out, how many friends he can have lunch with. 
 

Input
 The first line of Input contains an Integer N
The second line of Input contains N space separated integers, the length of each of the chopstick, Vaishnav had in his hand as he reached the lunch hall.

Output
Output a single Iine, the number of friends he can have lunch with. 
If Vaishnav doesn't have chopsticks output -1 instead.

Constraints
Should contain all the constraints on the input data that you may have. Format it like:

1 ≤ N ≤ 10000
1 ≤ Ni ≤ 10000

 

Example
Input:
9
1 5 2 7 9 2 5 7 9

Output:
3
